meanings.definition: To cause a traffic jam by blocking the flow of vehicles.
meanings.sent1: The accident was gridlocking the highway during rush hour.
meanings.sent2: Construction work often leads to gridlocking the streets in the city.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn donkey gridlocked the road by refusing to move.
meanings.sent4: Her indecisiveness gridlocked the team's progress on the project.
meanings.sent5: The fallen tree gridlocked the only road out of town, causing chaos.

meanings.definition: To prevent progress or movement by creating a deadlock or impasse.
meanings.sent1: The negotiations were gridlocking as neither side would compromise.
meanings.sent2: The political disagreement gridlocked the decision-making process.
meanings.sent3: The two stubborn siblings gridlocked over who gets the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure gridlocked his ability to take risks and grow.
meanings.sent5: The frozen computer screen gridlocked his work, frustrating him to no end.
